What is the purpose of the `fromaddresses` argument in a transaction?

The `fromaddresses` argument is used to specify the addresses from which to merge UTXOs or notes. It can be a JSON array of addresses, including t-addrs and z-addrs. Additionally, special strings like "ANY_TADDR", "ANY_SPROUT", and "ANY_SAPLING" can be used to merge UTXOs or notes from any addresses of the specified type belonging to the wallet.

Arguments:
1. fromaddresses     (array, required) A JSON array with addresses.
             The following special strings are accepted inside the array:
               - "ANY_TADDR":  Merge UTXOs from any t-addrs belonging to the wallet.
               - "ANY_SPROUT": Merge notes from any Sprout zaddrs belonging to the wallet.
               - "ANY_SAPLING": Merge notes from any Sapling zaddrs belonging to the wallet.
             While it is possible to use a variety of different combinations of addresses and the above values,
             it is not possible to send funds from both sprout and sapling addresses simultaneously. If a special
             string is given, any given addresses of that type will be counted as duplicates and cause an error.
  [
   "address"     (string) Can be a t-addr or a zaddr
   ,...
  ]
2. "toaddress"      (string, required) The t-addr or zaddr to send the funds to.
3. fee          (numeric, optional, default=0.0001) The fee amount to attach to this transaction.
4. transparent_limit   (numeric, optional, default=50) Limit on the maximum number of UTXOs to merge. Set to 0 to use node option -mempooltxinputlimit (before Overwinter), or as many as will fit in the transaction (after Overwinter).
5. shielded_limit    (numeric, optional, default=20 Sprout or 200 Sapling Notes) Limit on the maximum number of notes to merge. Set to 0 to merge as many as will fit in the transaction.
6. "memo"        (string, optional) Encoded as hex. When toaddress is a zaddr, this will be stored in the memo field of the new note.
./raw_text_input_api_text/z_mergetoaddress
What happens if I try to send funds from both Sprout and Sapling addresses simultaneously?
It is not possible to send funds from both Sprout and Sapling addresses simultaneously. If you try to do so, any given addresses of the same type will be counted as duplicates and cause an error.

               - "ANY_SPROUT": Merge notes from any Sprout zaddrs belonging to the wallet.
               - "ANY_SAPLING": Merge notes from any Sapling zaddrs belonging to the wallet.
             While it is possible to use a variety of different combinations of addresses and the above values,
             it is not possible to send funds from both sprout and sapling addresses simultaneously. If a special

What is the purpose of the `toaddress` argument in a transaction?
The `toaddress` argument is used to specify the t-addr or zaddr to which the funds should be sent.

What is the default fee amount attached to a transaction if the `fee` argument is not specified?
The default fee amount attached to a transaction is 0.0001 if the `fee` argument is not specified.

What is the purpose of the `transparent_limit` argument in a transaction?

The `transparent_limit` argument is used to set a limit on the maximum number of UTXOs to merge in a transaction. If set to 0, it will use the node option `-mempooltxinputlimit` (before Overwinter) or merge as many UTXOs as will fit in the transaction (after Overwinter).

             The following special strings are accepted inside the array:
               - "ANY_TADDR":  Merge UTXOs from any t-addrs belonging to the wallet.
               - "ANY_SPROUT": Merge notes from any Sprout zaddrs belonging to the wallet.
               - "ANY_SAPLING": Merge notes from any Sapling zaddrs belonging to the wallet.
             While it is possible to use a variety of different combinations of addresses and the above values,
             it is not possible to send funds from both sprout and sapling addresses simultaneously. If a special
             string is given, any given addresses of that type will be counted as duplicates and cause an error.

   "address"     (string) Can be a t-addr or a zaddr

What is the purpose of the `shielded_limit` argument in a transaction?

The `shielded_limit` argument is used to set a limit on the maximum number of notes to merge in a transaction. If set to 0, it will merge as many notes as will fit in the transaction. The default limit is 20 Sprout notes or 200 Sapling notes.

Arguments:
1. fromaddresses     (array, required) A JSON array with addresses.
             The following special strings are accepted inside the array:
               - "ANY_TADDR":  Merge UTXOs from any t-addrs belonging to the wallet.
               - "ANY_SPROUT": Merge notes from any Sprout zaddrs belonging to the wallet.
               - "ANY_SAPLING": Merge notes from any Sapling zaddrs belonging to the wallet.
             While it is possible to use a variety of different combinations of addresses and the above values,
             it is not possible to send funds from both sprout and sapling addresses simultaneously. If a special
             string is given, any given addresses of that type will be counted as duplicates and cause an error.
  [

   ,...

What is the purpose of the `memo` argument in a transaction?
The `memo` argument is used to store an encoded message in the memo field of the new note when the `toaddress` is a zaddr. The message should be encoded as hex.
